item.title: Tammy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tammy add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "It is both relaxing and invigorating to occasionally set aside the worries of life, seek the company of a friendly book...from the reading of 'good books' there comes a richness of life that can be obtained in no other way." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Tammy add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Tammy add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Tammy add a quote by George Washington Burnap
item.description: "The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for." -- George Washington Burnap

item.title: Tammy add a quote by Elizabeth Berg
item.description: "You are always in my thoughts. When you were little, I knew your whereabouts at any given moment. Now that you are...off on your own, I still always know where you are, because I keep you in my heart." -- Elizabeth Berg
